greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts, none being 2.
comment: With offset 2 (and a(0)=a(1)=0) the number of 2's in all partitions of n into distinct parts. [_Joerg Arndt_, Feb 20 2014]
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Cristina Ballantine, Mircea Merca, On identities of Watson type, Ars Mathematica Contemporanea (2019) Vol. 17, 277-290.
mathematica: Table[Count[Select[IntegerPartitions[n], DeleteDuplicates[#] == # &], x_ /; ! MemberQ[x, 2]], {n, 0, 57}] (* _Robert Price_, May 17 2020 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
ext: Corrected and extended by _Dean Hickerson_, Oct 10, 2001
